content: this text is a summary of a legal case that went to the cassation court the case involves a divorce and the assessment of a maintenance allowance that the defendant should pay the court determined that the defendant should pay a subsistence allowance of eur 700 per month since the divorce became final the court also noted that the plaintiff took possession of the property so the defendant would need to vacate and rent a new house the court clarified that the subsistence allowance is not necessarily a monthly payment but rather a debt that is part of the defendants share of the undivided property the defendants appeal challenging this assessment failed to provide a factual basis and was considered speculative so it lacked legal merit the courts decision was based on specific articles of the civil code and the court cassation belgium detention the court also considered the possibility of adjusting the maintenance allowance based on changes in the financial situation of the parties the plaintiffs plea was dismissed and the plaintiff was ordered to pay the costs
